title: Since 1990s, heart attacks have become less deadly, frequent for Americans

title_detail.value: Since 1990s, heart attacks have become less deadly, frequent for Americans

summary: Heart attack prevention and outcomes have dramatically improved for American adults in the past two decades, according to a new study. Compared to the mid-1990s, Americans today are less likely to have heart attacks and also less likely to die from them, said the researchers.
